person:biography.personal-details:content: I am primarily specialized in high energy gamma-ray and neutrino astroparticle physics. I am author of more than 80 publications on reviewed journals. I obtained my PhD degree in particle physics at the ETH Zurich. I have more than 18 years of experience in experimental high-energy physics through four large European projects (CTA, ANTARES, H1, OPERA) working in six relevant institutions (UPM, CIEMAT, IFIC, NIKHEF, INFN, ETH). Currently, I have a principle investigator position shared between Universidad Polit√©cnia de Madrid and CIEMAT research center fund by the BBVA Foundation with a Leonardo scholarship. I develop machine learning methods to study images taken by the Cherenkov Telescope Array observatory. Specifically, I use convolutional neural networks to classify signal and background events and reconstruct the parameters of the primary gamma-ray particles. In addition, I have a lecturer position in the Instituto Universitario de Microgravedad "Ignacio Da Riva" in the Technical University of Madrid. As lecturer I teach spacecraft dynamics and control in the space system master (MUSE). Previously, I was working as a post-doc in the Instituto de Fisica Corpuscular (IFIC-CSIC in Valencia, Spain) in the group of the ANTARES collaboration. I started my post-doc career in the ANTARES group at the National Institute for Subatomic Physics (NIKHEF in Amsterdam, Netherlands) in 2006.
